intro: Rhynchospora globularis var. typica, commonly known as the globular flatsedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marsh environments in North America. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with slender, cylindrical stems that are often reddish in color. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in dense, globular inflorescences, which give it its common name. Its leaves are narrow, linear, and often have a bluish-green hue. Rhynchospora globularis var. typica plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
